member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Default amount of time (in seconds) GET / POST request awaits for response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.DEFAULT_DOWNLOAD_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Default amount of time (in seconds) DOWNLOAD request awaits for response.

member.name: T:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode
member.summary: 1xx --> Informational Response (the request was received, continuing process) 2xx --> Successful (the request was successfully received, understood, and accepted) 3xx --> Redirection (further action needs to be taken in order to complete the request) 4xx --> Client Error (the request contains bad syntax or cannot be fulfilled) 5xx --> Server Error (the server failed to fulfil an apparently valid request) Learn More

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UNDEFINED_ERROR
member.summary: Negative value indicating that something went wrong. Usually used in context of an unhandled exception.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NONE
member.summary: Default value indicating that there's nothing to return. Usually used in context of request timeout.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.CONTINUE
member.summary: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SWITCHING_PROTOCOLS
member.summary: The requester has asked the server to switch protocols and the server has agreed to do so.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PROCESSING
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 2518) This code indicates that the server has received and is processing the request, but no response is available yet.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.EARLY_HINTS
member.summary: Used to return some response headers before final HTTP message.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.RESPONSE_IS_STALE
member.summary: The response provided by a cache is stale (the content's age exceeds a maximum age set by a Cache-Control header or heuristically chosen lifetime).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.REVALIDATION_FAILED
member.summary: The cache was unable to validate the response, due to an inability to reach the origin server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.DISCONNECTED_OPERATION
member.summary: The cache is intentionally disconnected from the rest of the network.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.HEURISTIC_EXPIRATION
member.summary: The cache heuristically chose a freshness lifetime greater than 24 hours and the response's age is greater than 24 hours.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MISCELLANEOUS_WARNING
member.summary: Arbitrary, non-specific warning. The warning text may be logged or presented to the user.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.OK
member.summary: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.CREATED
member.summary: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ACCEPTED
member.summary: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NON_AUTHORITATIVE_INFORMATION
member.summary: (since HTTP/1.1) The server is a transforming proxy (e.g. a Web accelerator) that received a 200 OK from its origin, but is returning a modified version of the origin's response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NO_CONTENT
member.summary: The server successfully processed the request, and is not returning any content.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.RESET_CONTENT
member.summary: The server successfully processed the request, asks that the requester reset its document view, and is not returning any content.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PARTIAL_CONTENT
member.summary: (RFC 7233) The server is delivering only part of the resource (byte serving) due to a range header sent by the client. The range header is used by HTTP clients to enable resuming of interrupted downloads, or split a download into multiple simultaneous streams.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MULTI_STATUS
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 4918) The message body that follows is by default an XML message and can contain a number of separate response codes, depending on how many sub-requests were made.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ALREADY_REPORTED
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 5842) The members of a DAV binding have already been enumerated in a preceding part of the (multistatus) response, and are not being included again.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.TRANSFORMATION_APPLIED
member.summary: Added by a proxy if it applies any transformation to the representation, such as changing the content encoding, media type or the like.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MISCELLANEOUS_PERSISTENT_WARNING
member.summary: Same as 199 (MISCELLANEOUS_WARNING), but indicating a persistent warning.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.IM_USED
member.summary: (RFC 3229) The server has fulfilled a request for the resource, and the response is a representation of the result of one or more instance-manipulations applied to the current instance.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MULTIPLE_CHOISES
member.summary: Indicates multiple options for the resource from which the client may choose.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MOVED_PERMANENTLY
member.summary: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.FOUND
member.summary: (Previously "Moved temporarily") Tells the client to look at (browse to) another URL.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SEE_OTHER
member.summary: (since HTTP/1.1) The response to the request can be found under another URI using the GET method. When received in response to a POST (or PUT/DELETE), the client should presume that the server has received the data and should issue a new GET request to the given URI.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NOT_MODIFIED
member.summary: (RFC 7232) Indicates that the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request headers If-Modified-Since or If-None-Match.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.USE_PROXY
member.summary: (since HTTP/1.1) The requested resource is available only through a proxy, the address for which is provided in the response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SWITCH_PROXY
member.summary: No longer used. Originally meant "Subsequent requests should use the specified proxy."

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.TEMPORARY_REDIRECT
member.summary: (since HTTP/1.1) In this case, the request should be repeated with another URI; however, future requests should still use the original URI.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PERMANENT_REDIRECT
member.summary: (RFC 7538) This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.BAD_REQUEST
member.summary: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UNAUTHORIZED
member.summary: (RFC 7235) Similar to 403 Forbidden, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PAYMENT_REQUIRED
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.FORBIDDEN
member.summary: The request contained valid data and was understood by the server, but the server is refusing action.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
member.summary: A request method is not supported for the requested resource; for example, a GET request on a form that requires data to be presented via POST, or a PUT request on a read-only resource.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NOT_ACCEPTABLE
member.summary: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PROXY_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED
member.summary: (RFC 7235) The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.REQUEST_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The server timed out waiting for the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.CONFLICT
member.summary: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource, such as an edit conflict between multiple simultaneous updates.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.GONE
member.summary: Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.LENGTH_REQUIRED
member.summary: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PRECONDITION_FAILED
member.summary: (RFC 7232) The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request header fields.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PAYLOAD_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: (RFC 7231) The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.URI_TOO_LONG
member.summary: (RFC 7231) The URI provided was too long for the server to process.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE
member.summary: (RFC 7231) The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.RANGE_NOT_SATISFIABLE
member.summary: (RFC 7233) The client has asked for a portion of the file (byte serving), but the server cannot supply that portion.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.EXPECTATION_FAILED
member.summary: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.IM_A_TEAPOT
member.summary: (RFC 2324, RFC 7168) This code was defined in 1998 as one of the traditional IETF April Fools' jokes.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PAGE_EXPIRED
member.summary: (Laravel Framework) Used by the Laravel Framework when a CSRF Token is missing or expired.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ENCHANCE_YOUR_CALM
member.summary: (Twitter) Returned by version 1 of the Twitter Search and Trends API when the client is being rate limited.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.MISDIRECTED_REQUEST
member.summary: (RFC 7540) The request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 4918) The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.LOCKED
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 4918) The resource that is being accessed is locked.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.FAILED_DEPENDECY
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 4918) The request failed because it depended on another request and that request failed.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.TOO_EARLY
member.summary: (RFC 8470) Indicates that the server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UPGRADE_REQUIRED
member.summary: The client should switch to a different protocol such as TLS/1.3, given in the Upgrade header field.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.PRECONDITION_REQUIRED
member.summary: (RFC 6585) The origin server requires the request to be conditional.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.TOO_MANY_REQUESTS
member.summary: (RFC 6585) The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.REQUEST_HEADER_FIELDS_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: (RFC 6585) The server is unwilling to process the request because either an individual header field, or all the header fields collectively, are too large.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.LOGIN_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The client's session has expired and must log in again.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NO_RESPONSE
member.summary: Used internally to instruct the server to return no information to the client and close the connection immediately.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.RETRY_WITH
member.summary: The server cannot honour the request because the user has not provided the required information.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.BLOCKED_BY_WINDOWS_PARENTAL_CONTROL
member.summary: (Microsoft) The Microsoft extension code indicated when Windows Parental Controls are turned on and are blocking access to the requested webpage.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.UNAVAILABLE_FOR_LEGAL_REASONS
member.summary: (RFC 7725) A server operator has received a legal demand to deny access to a resource or to a set of resources that includes the requested resource.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ELB460
member.summary: Client closed the connection with the load balancer before the idle timeout period elapsed.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ELB463
member.summary: The load balancer received an X-Forwarded-For request header with more than 30 IP addresses.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ELBUNAUTHORIZED
member.summary: An error around authentication returned by a server registered with a load balancer.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.REQUEST_HEADER_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: Client sent too large request or too long header line.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SSL_CERTIFICATE_ERROR
member.summary: An expansion of the 400 Bad Request response code, used when the client has provided an invalid client certificate.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SSL_CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED
member.summary: An expansion of the 400 Bad Request response code, used when a client certificate is required but not provided.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.HTTP_REQUEST_SENT_TO_HTTPS_PORT
member.summary: An expansion of the 400 Bad Request response code, used when the client has made a HTTP request to a port listening for HTTPS requests.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.CLIENT_CLOSED_REQUEST
member.summary: Used when the client has closed the request before the server could send a response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
member.summary: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NOT_IMPLEMENTED
member.summary: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.BAD_GATEWAY
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: The server cannot handle the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.GATEWAY_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.HTTP_VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.VARIANT_ALSO_NEGOTIATES
member.summary: (RFC 2295) Transparent content negotiation for the request results in a circular reference.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 4918) The server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.LOOP_DETECTED
member.summary: (WebDAV; RFC 5842) The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.BANDWIDTH_LIMIT_EXCEEDED
member.summary: (Apache Web Server/cPanel) The server has exceeded the bandwidth specified by the server administrator.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NOT_EXTENDED
member.summary: (RFC 2774) Further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfil it.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NETWORK_AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED
member.summary: (RFC 6585) The client needs to authenticate to gain network access.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.WEB_SERVER_RETURNED_AN_UNKNOWN_ERROR
member.summary: The origin server returned an empty, unknown, or unexpected response to Cloudflare.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.WEB_SERVER_IS_DOWN
member.summary: The origin server refused connections from Cloudflare.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT
member.summary: Cloudflare timed out contacting the origin server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.ORIGIN_IS_UNREACHABLE
member.summary: Cloudflare could not reach the origin server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.A_TIMEOUT_OCCURED
member.summary: Cloudflare was able to complete a TCP connection to the origin server, but did not receive a timely HTTP response.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SSL_HANDSHAKE_FAILED
member.summary: Cloudflare could not negotiate a SSL/TLS handshake with the origin server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.INVALID_SSL_CERTIFICATE
member.summary: Cloudflare could not validate the SSL certificate on the origin web server. Also used by Cloud Foundry's gorouter.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.RAILGUN_ERROR
member.summary: Error 527 indicates an interrupted connection between Cloudflare and the origin server's Railgun server.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.SITE_IS_OVERLOADED
member.summary: Used by Qualys in the SSLLabs server testing API to signal that the site can't process the request.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.С530
member.summary: Error 530 is returned along with a 1xxx error.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NETWORK_READ_TIMEOUT_ERROR
member.summary: (Informal convention) Used by some HTTP proxies to signal a network read timeout behind the proxy to a client in front of the proxy.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.E_StatusCode.NETWORK_CONNECT_TIMEOUT_ERROR
member.summary: An error used by some HTTP proxies to signal a network connect timeout behind the proxy to a client in front of the proxy.

member.name: T:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType
member.summary: Default set of content-type headers.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_java_archive
member.summary: Java archive files, often used for distributing Java applications.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_EDI_X12
member.summary: Format for electronic data interchange (EDI) used in business transactions.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_EDIFACT
member.summary: Standard for EDI used in international trade.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_javascript
member.summary: JavaScript files used to execute scripts on web pages.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_octet_stream
member.summary: Generic binary data, often used for arbitrary file types.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_ogg
member.summary: Container format for multimedia, including audio and video.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_pdf
member.summary: Portable Document Format, used for documents that preserve formatting.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_xhtml_xml
member.summary: XHTML documents, an XML-based version of HTML.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_x_shockwave_flash
member.summary: Format for multimedia, especially web animations (obsolete).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_json
member.summary: Data format used for structured data exchange.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_ld_json
member.summary: JSON format used for linked data in web applications.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_xml
member.summary: General XML data files.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_zip
member.summary: Compressed archive files containing one or more files.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_x_www_form_urlencoded
member.summary: Format for sending form data in HTTP requests.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.audio_mpeg
member.summary: MPEG audio files, commonly known as MP3.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.audio_x_ms_wma
member.summary: Windows Media Audio format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.audio_vnd_rn_realaudio
member.summary: RealAudio format for streaming audio.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.audio_x_wav
member.summary: Waveform Audio File Format, uncompressed audio.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_gif
member.summary: Graphics Interchange Format, supporting animations.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_jpeg
member.summary: Compressed image format for digital photos.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_png
member.summary: Lossless image format, widely used for web graphics.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_tiff
member.summary: High-quality image format, often used in publishing.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_vnd_microsoft_icon
member.summary: Format for Windows icons.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_x_icon
member.summary: Icon file format, used for web favicons.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_vnd_djvu
member.summary: Format for scanned documents with high compression.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.image_svg_xml
member.summary: Scalable Vector Graphics, an XML-based vector image format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.multipart_mixed
member.summary: Used for multipart email content combining different media types.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.multipart_alternative
member.summary: Email format containing the same content in different forms (e.g., plain text and HTML).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.multipart_related
member.summary: Email format for sending related data, such as inline images in HTML.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.multipart_form_data
member.summary: Used for forms that upload files via HTTP.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_css
member.summary: Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling web pages.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_csv
member.summary: Comma-separated values, a format for tabular data.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_html
member.summary: Standard markup language for web pages.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_javascript
member.summary: Legacy MIME type for JavaScript scripts (obsolete).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_plain
member.summary: Plain text files without formatting.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.text_xml
member.summary: XML text files.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_mpeg
member.summary: MPEG video format, an early standard for video compression.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_mp4
member.summary: Modern, widely used format for video compression.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_quicktime
member.summary: Format for QuickTime multimedia by Apple.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_x_ms_wmv
member.summary: Windows Media Video format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_x_msvideo
member.summary: AVI (Audio Video Interleave) format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_x_flv
member.summary: Flash Video format (obsolete).

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.video_webm
member.summary: Open, web-optimized video format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_vnd_android_package_archive
member.summary: Android Package files for app distribution.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_vnd_oasis_opendocument_text
member.summary: OpenDocument text format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_vnd_oasis_opendocument_spreadsheet
member.summary: OpenDocument spreadsheet format.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_ContentType.application_vnd_oasis_opendocument_presentation
member.summary: OpenDocument presentation format.

member.summary: Represents Google's web crawling bot, used for indexing and searching web pages.

member.summary: Represents Apple's tvOS, indicating an Apple TV device.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Opera_Windows
member.summary: Opera browser running on a 64-bit Windows platform with the Presto rendering engine.

member.summary: Opera browser running on a 32-bit Linux platform with the Presto rendering engine.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Opera_Mini
member.summary: Lightweight version of Opera designed for mobile devices, using the Presto engine with WebKit.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Windows
member.summary: Mozilla Firefox browser on a 64-bit Windows platform, powered by the Gecko engine.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Linux
member.summary: Mozilla Firefox browser on a 32/64-bit Linux platform, powered by the Gecko engine.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Ubuntu
member.summary: Mozilla Firefox browser on a 64-bit Ubuntu Linux platform, powered by the Gecko engine.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Android
member.summary: Mozilla Firefox browser on an Android device, incorporating WebKit and Chrome-like capabilities.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Legacy_Windows
member.summary: An older version of Mozilla compatible with Internet Explorer 2.0 on Windows 3.1.

member.name: F:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.SE_UserAgent.Mozilla_Legacy_Linux
member.summary: Legacy User-Agent for the Konqueror browser on Linux, using the KHTML engine (like Gecko).

member.name: M:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.Download(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads content from the specified URL with optional headers, data, and timeout, and saves it to a specified destination path if provided.
member.param: The URL to download the content from.
member.returns: An object containing the response from the request.

member.name: M:CranchyLib.Networking.Networking.Download(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Downloads content from the specified URL with optional headers, data, and timeout, and saves it to a specified destination path if provided.
member.param: The URL to download the content from.
The file path to save the downloaded content. If not provided, the content will be stored in current user downloads folder.
member.returns: An object containing the response from the request.
